meanings.definition: A white crystalline compound, potassium nitrate, used in gunpowder and fertilizer.
meanings.sent1: The soldiers loaded their guns with saltpetre to make them powerful.
meanings.sent2: Farmers use saltpetre to help their crops grow healthy and strong.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous kids thought saltpetre was sugar and tried to taste it.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was like saltpetre, fueling her to achieve her goals.
meanings.sent5: The smell of saltpetre filled the air, reminding them of the upcoming fireworks display.

meanings.sent1: The blacksmith would saltpetre the metal to make it more resistant to rust.
meanings.sent2: She decided to saltpetre the old wooden fence to preserve it for a longer time.
meanings.sent3: The chef accidentally saltpetred the soup instead of adding salt, creating a strange taste.
meanings.sent4: His words seemed to saltpetre her wounds, making them hurt even more.
meanings.sent5: The gardener would carefully saltpetre the soil to ensure the plants grew well.
